strategy: Apply a gradient boosting machine (e.g., XGBoost, LightGBM, or CatBoost) with tuned hyperparameters using Bayesian optimization to maximize R2. Instead of polynomial features, use only raw input features with categorical encoding (e.g., one-hot or target encoding) and introduce feature interactions via interaction terms manually constructed from key features (e.g., area × bedrooms). Use cross-validation with early stopping to prevent overfitting and focus on stable performance on unseen data. This leverages the strong non-linear decision boundaries of gradient boosting while maintaining interpretability through feature importance analysis.
